nidoranm.evolve: Nidoran ♂ can evolve into Nidorino at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 5 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

nidorina.desc: When resting deep in its burrow, its barbs always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.
nidorina.evolve: Nidorina can evolve into Nidoqueen at level 14 and above with the help of a Moon Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

nidorino.desc: Its horn contains venom. If it stabs an enemy with the horn, the impact makes the poison leak out.
nidorino.evolve: Nidorino can evolve into Nidoking at level 14 and above with the help of a Moon Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

nincada.desc: Nincada lives underground for many years in complete darkness. This Pokémon absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.
nincada.evolve: Nincada can evolve into Ninjask at level 6 and above. If its trainer has an empty Pokeslot, they also acquire a Shedinja at the same level. The Shedinja has all the base statistics that are in its stat block, plus any health and Ability Score Increases it would obtain from leveling up from its minimum found level. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 15 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

ninetails.desc: According to an enduring legend, nine noble saints were united and reincarnated as this Pokémon.

ninjask.desc: Ninjask moves around at such a high speed that it cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard. For that reason, this Pokémon was long believed to be invisible.

noctowl.desc: When it turns its head entirely upside down, you know it’s troubled by something. If you don’t leave it be, it will peck you.

nosepass.desc: Nosepass's magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these Pokémon meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.

numel.desc: Numel is extremely dull witted-it doesn't notice being hit. However, it can't stand hunger for even a second. This Pokémon's body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.
numel.evolve: Numel can evolve into Camerupt at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

nuzleaf.desc: Nuzleaf live in densely overgrown forests. They occasionally venture out of the forest to startle people. This Pokémon dislikes having its long nose pinched.
nuzleaf.evolve: Nuzleaf can evolve into Shiftry at level 10 and above with the help of a Leaf Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

octillery.desc: The ink it spits when escaping is special. It contains a substance that dulls the sense of smell, so Pokémon with keen noses get lost.

oddish.desc: It may be mistaken for a clump of weeds. If you try to yank it out of the ground, it shrieks horribly.
oddish.evolve: Oddish can evolve into Gloom at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 7 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

omanyte.desc: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swam by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.
omanyte.evolve: Omanyte can evolve into Omastar at level 10 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

omastar.desc: Its sharp beak rings its mouth. Its shell was too big for it to move freely, so it became extinct.

onix.desc: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
onix.evolve: Onix can evolve into Steelix at level 12 and above while holding a Steel Coat. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 7 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

paras.desc: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
paras.evolve: Paras can evolve into Parasect at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

parasect.desc: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

pelipper.desc: Pelipper is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon and eggs inside its massive bill. This Pokémon builds its nest on steep cliffs facing the sea.

persian.desc: The gem in its forehead glows on its own! It walks with all the grace and elegance of a proud queen.

phanpy.desc: For its nest, Phanpy digs a vertical pit in the ground at the edge of a river. It marks the area around its nest with its trunk to let the others know that the area has been claimed.
phanpy.evolve: Phanpy can evolve into Donphan at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

pichu.desc: It still can’t use electricity well. When it’s surprised or excited, it discharges electricity unintentionally.
pichu.evolve: Pichu can evolve into Pikachu at level 3 and above if its loyalty level is +2 or higher. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 7 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

pidgeotto.desc: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

pidgey.desc: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
pidgey.evolve: Pidgey can evolve into Pidgeotto at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 7 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

pikachu.desc: This forest-dwelling Pokémon stores electricity in its cheeks, so you’ll feel a tingly shock if you touch it.
pikachu.evolve: Pikachu can evolve into Raichu at level 8 and above with the help of a Thunder Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

piloswine.desc: Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables it to endure the freezing cold. This Pokémon uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.

pineco.desc: Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to come along. If the Pokémon is disturbed while eating by someone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and explodes with no warning.
pineco.evolve: Pineco can evolve into Forretress at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

pinsir.desc: Grips its prey in its pincers and squeezes hard! It can’t move if it’s cold out, so it lives in warm places.

plusle.desc: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.

politoed.desc: The longer and more luxurious the curled hair on its head, the greater the number of Poliwag and Poliwhirl that will obey it.

poliwag.desc: The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by area. It is more adept at swimming than walking.
poliwag.evolve: Poliwag can evolve into Poliwhirl at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 6 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

poliwhirl.desc: Under attack, it uses its belly spiral to put the foe to sleep. It then makes its escape.
poliwhirl.evolve: Poliwhirl can evolve into Poliwrath at level 14 and above with the help of a Water Stone, or Politoed at level 14 while holding a King's Rock. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

poliwrath.desc: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.

ponyta.desc: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
ponyta.evolve: Ponyta can evolve into Rapidash at level 10 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

poochyena.desc: At first sight, Poochyena takes a bite at anything that moves. This Pokémon chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.
poochyena.evolve:
Poochyena can evolve into Mightyena at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health
 ncreases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

porygon.desc: The only Pokémon that people anticipate can fly into space. None has managed the feat yet, however.
porygon.evolve: Porygon can evolve into Porygon2 at level 9 and above while holding an Upgrade. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

porygon2.desc: Porygon2 was created by humans using the power of science. The man-made Pokémon has been endowed with artificial intelligence that enables it to learn new gestures and emotions on its own.

primeape.desc: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

psyduck.desc: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but whether it intends to do so is not known.
psyduck.evolve: Psyduck can evolve into Golduck at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 6 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

pupitar.desc: Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it compresses and forcefully ejects to propel itself like a jet. The body is very durable-it avoids damage even if it hits solid steel.
pupitar.evolve: Evolution: Pupitar can evolve into Tyranitar at level 16 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 15 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

quagsire.desc: Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because the Pokémon does not move, it does not get very hungry.

quilava.desc: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
quilava.evolve: Quilava can evolve into Typhlosion at level 14 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

qwilfish.desc: Qwilfish sucks in water, inflating itself. This Pokémon uses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming somewhat challenging.

raichu.desc: When electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes feisty. It also glows in the dark.

raikou.desc: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

ralts.desc: Ralts senses the emotions of people using the horns on its head. This Pokémon rarely appears before people. But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person has a positive disposition.
ralts.evolve: Ralts can evolve into Kirlia at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 7 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

rapidash.desc: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.

raticate.desc: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

rattata.desc: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.
rattata.evolve: Rattata can evolve into Raticate at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

rayquaza.desc: Rayquaza is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years. Legends remain of how it put to rest the clash between Kyogre and Groudon.

regice.desc: Regice's body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can't be melted, even by fire. This Pokémon controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.

regirock.desc: Regirock was sealed away by people long ago. If this Pokémon's body is damaged in battle, it is said to seek out suitable rocks on its own to repair itself.

registeel.desc: Registeel has a body that is harder than any kind of metal. Its body is apparently hollow. No one has any idea what this Pokémon eats.

relicanth.desc: Relicanth is a Pokémon species that existed for a hundred million years without ever changing its form. This ancient Pokémon feeds on microscopic organisms with its toothless mouth.

remoraid.desc: This Pokémon clings to Mantine and shares in its prosperity. When its Mantine is attacked, Remoraid will fight alongside it!
remoraid.evolve: Remoraid can evolve into Octillery at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

rhydon.desc: Its brain developed when it began walking on its hind legs. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.

rhyhorn.desc: A Pokémon with a one-track mind. Once it charges, it won’t stop running until it falls asleep.
rhyhorn.evolve: Rhyhorn can evolve into Rhydon at level 11 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

roselia.desc: Roselia shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this Pokémon brings serenity to living things.

sableye.desc: Sableye digs the ground with sharpened claws to find rocks that it eats. Substances in the eaten rocks crystallize and rise up to the Pokémon's body surface.

salamence.desc: By evolving into Salamence, this Pokémon finally realizes its long-held dream of growing wings. To express its joy, it flies and wheels all over the sky while spouting flames from its mouth.

sandshrew.desc: Its body is dry. When it gets cold at night, its hide is said to become coated with a fine dew.
sandshrew.evolve: Sandshrew can evolve into Sandslash at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

sandslash.desc: It is skilled at slashing enemies with its claws. If broken, they start to grow back in a day.

sceptile.desc: he leaves growing on Sceptile's body are very sharp edged. This Pokémon is very agile-it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.

scizor.desc: Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. This Pokémon flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.

scyther.desc: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
scyther.evolve: Scyther can evolve into Scizor at level 14 and above while holding a Steel Coat. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 7 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

seadra.desc: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.
seadra.evolve: Seadra can evolve into Kingdra at level 14 and above while holding a Dragon Scale. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

seaking.desc: It is the male’s job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.

sealeo.desc: Sealeo has the habit of always juggling on the tip of its nose anything it sees for the first time. This Pokémon occasionally entertains itself by balancing and rolling a Spheal on its nose.
sealeo.evolve: Sealeo can evolve into Walrein at level 16 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

seedot.desc: Seedot attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this Pokémon's body becomes.
seedot.evolve: Seedot can evolve into Nuzleaf at level 5 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 11 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

seel.desc: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
seel.evolve: Seel can evolve into Dewgong at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

sentret.desc: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
sentret.evolve: Sentret can evolve into Furret at level 5 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

seviper.desc: Seviper shares a generations-long feud with Zangoose. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This Pokémon attacks using its sword-edged tail.

sharpedo.desc: Sharpedo can swim at speeds of up to 75 mph by jetting seawater out of its backside. This Pokémon's drawback is its inability to swim long distances.

shedinja.desc: Shedinja's hard body doesn't move-not even a twitch. In fact, its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that this Pokémon will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its hollow body from its back.

shelder.desc: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
shelder.evolve: Shellder can evolve into Cloyster at level 8 and above with the help of a Water Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

shelgon.desc: Covering Shelgon's body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this Pokémon hides away in a cavern.
shelgon.evolve: Shelgon can evolve into Salamence at level 16 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

shiftry.desc: Shiftry is a mysterious Pokémon that is said to live atop towering trees dating back over a thousand years. It creates terrific windstorms with the fans it holds.

shroomish.desc: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon's spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.
shroomish.evolve: Shroomish can evolve into Breloom at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

shuckle.desc: Shuckle quietly hides itself under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its hard shell while eating berries it has stored away. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.

shuppet.desc: Shuppet grows by feeding on dark emotions, such as vengefulness and envy, in the hearts of people. It roams through cities in search of grudges that taint people.
shuppet.evolve: Shuppet can evolve into Banette at level 10 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 14 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

silcoon.desc: Silcoon tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from falling. There, this Pokémon hangs quietly while it awaits evolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.
silcoon.evolve: Silcoon can evolve into Beautifly at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

skarmory.desc: he wing feathers it sheds can be processed and made into knives whose sharpness is recognized by the finest chefs.

skiploom.desc: Skiploom's flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.
skiploom.evolve: Skiploom can evolve into Jumpluff at level 12 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 7 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

skitty.desc: Skitty has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This Pokémon is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.
skitty.evolve: Skitty can evolve into Delcatty at level 8 and above with the help of a Moon Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

slaking.desc: Slaking spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this Pokémon reluctantly moves to another spot.

slakoth.desc: Slakoth's heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.
slakoth.evolve: Slakoth can evolve into Vigoroth at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

slowbro.desc: Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.

slowking.desc: Slowking undertakes research every day in an effort to solve the mysteries of the world. However, this Pokémon apparently forgets everything it has learned if the Shellder on its head comes off.

slowpoke.desc: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.
slowpoke.evolve: Slowpoke can evolve into Slowbro at level 10 and above, or Slowking at level 10 and above while holding a King's Rock. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 14 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

slugma.desc: Molten magma courses throughout Slugma's circulatory system. If this Pokémon is chilled, the magma cools and hardens. Its body turns brittle and chunks fall off, reducing its size.
slugma.evolve: Slugma can evolve into Magcargo at level 10 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

smeargle.desc: Smeargle marks the boundaries of its territory using a body fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. Over 5,000 different marks left by this Pokémon have been found.

smoochum.desc: Smoochum actively runs about, but also falls quite often. Whenever the chance arrives, it will look for its reflection to make sure its face hasn't become dirty.
smoochum.evolve: Smoochum can evolve into Jynx at level 8 and above if its Loyalty level is +2 or higher. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 4 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

sneasel.desc: Sneasel scales trees by punching its hooked claws into the bark. This Pokémon seeks out unguarded nests and steals eggs for food while the parents are away.

snorlax.desc: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.

snorunt.desc: Snorunt survives by eating only snow and ice. Old folklore claims that a house visited by this Pokémon is sure to prosper for many generations to come.
snorunt.evolve: Snorunt can evolve into Glalie at level 14 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

snubbull.desc: By baring its fangs and making a scary face, Snubbull sends smaller Pokémon scurrying away in terror. However, this Pokémon seems a little sad at making its foes flee.
snubbull.evolve: Snubbull can evolve into Granbull at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 7 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

solrock.desc: Solrock is a new species of Pokémon that is said to have fallen from space. It floats in air and moves silently. In battle, this Pokémon releases intensely bright light.

spearow.desc: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
spearow.evolve: Spearow can evolve into Fearow at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

spheal.desc: Spheal always travels by rolling around on its ball-like body. When the season for ice floes arrives, this Pokémon can be seen rolling about on ice and crossing the sea.
spheal.evolve: Spheal can evolve into Sealeo at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

spinarak.desc: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.
spinarak.evolve: Spinarak can evolve into Ariados at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

spinda.desc: All the Spinda that exist in the world are said to have utterly unique spot patterns. The shaky, tottering steps of this Pokémon give it the appearance of dancing.

spoink.desc: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon's psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.
spoink.evolve: Spoink can evolve into Grumpig at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

squirtle.desc: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
squirtle.evolve: Squirtle can evolve into Wartortle at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 6 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

stantler.desc: Stantler's magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.

starmie.desc: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in seven colors.

staryu.desc: As long as the center section is unharmed, this Pokémon can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
staryu.evolve: Staryu can evolve into Starmie at level 9 and above with the help of a Water Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

steelix.desc: Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth's core. There are records of this Pokémon reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.

sudowoodo.desc: It’s so popular with the elderly that there’s a magazine devoted to this Pokémon. Fans obsess over the particular length and angle of its arms.

suicune.desc: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

sunflora.desc: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.

sunkern.desc: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
sunkern.evolve: Sunkern can evolve into Sunflora at level 7 and above with the help of a Sun Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

surskit.desc: If Surskit senses danger, it secretes a thick, sugary syrup from the tip of its head. There are some Pokémon that love eating this syrup.
surskit.evolve: Surskit can evolve into Masquerain at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

swablue.desc: Swablu has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This Pokémon is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.
swablue.evolve: Swablu can evolve into Altaria at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 15 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

swalot.desc: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon's mouth.

swampert.desc: Swampert is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This Pokémon also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.

swellow.desc: Swellow flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This Pokémon dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by Swellow's clawed feet, preventing escape.

swinub.desc: Swinub roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under the cover of dead grass. This Pokémon occasionally roots out hot springs.
swinub.evolve: Swinub can evolve into Piloswine at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

taillow.desc: Taillow courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy Pokémon will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
taillow.evolve: Taillow can evolve into Swellow at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 11 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

tangela.desc: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.

tauros.desc: A rowdy Pokémon with a lot of stamina. Once running, it won’t stop until it hits something.

teddiursa.desc: This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.
teddiursa.evolve: Teddiursa can evolve into Ursaring at level 8 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

tentacool.desc: It can sometimes be found all dry and shriveled up on a beach. Toss it back into the sea to revive it.
tentacool.evolve: Tentacool can evolve into Tentacruel at level 8 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

tentacruel.desc: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.

togepi.desc: As its energy, Togepi uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon. This Pokémon stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.
togepi.evolve: Togepi can evolve into Togetic at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

togetic.desc: Togetic is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune. When the Pokémon spots someone who is pure of heart, it is said to appear and share its happiness with that person.

torchic.desc: orchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug-it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
torchic.evolve: Torchic can evolve into Combusken at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 6 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

torkoal.desc: Torkoal generates energy by burning coal. It grows weaker as the fire dies down. When it is preparing for battle, this Pokémon burns more coal.

totodile.desc: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile's jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
totodile.evolve: Totodile can evolve into Croconaw at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 6 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

trapinch.desc: Trapinch is a patient hunter. It digs an inescapable pit in a desert and waits for its prey to come tumbling down. This Pokémon can go a whole week without access to any water.
trapinch.evolve: Trapinch can evolve into Vibrava at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

treecko.desc: Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pokémon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.
treecko.evolve: Treecko can evolve into Grovyle at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 6 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

tropius.desc: Children of the southern tropics eat as snacks the fruit that grows in bunches around the neck of Tropius. This Pokémon flies by flapping the leaves on its back as if they were wings.

typhlosion.desc: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

tyranitar.desc: Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémon wanders about in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.

tyrogue.desc: Tyrogue becomes stressed out if it does not get to train every day. When raising this Pokémon, the Trainer must establish and uphold various training methods.
tyrogue.evolve: Starting at level 6, Tyrogue can evolve into Hitmonchan if its STR is higher than its DEX, Hitmonlee if its DEX is higher than its STR, or Hitmontop if its STR is equal to its DEX. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

umbreon.desc: Umbreon evolved as a result of exposure to the moon's waves. It hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.

unown.desc: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

ursaring.desc: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.

vaporeon.desc: Its cell structure is similar to water molecules. It melts into the water and becomes invisible.

venomoth.desc: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

venonat.desc: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
venonat.evolve: Venonat can evolve into Venomoth at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

venusaur.desc: The flower on its back catches the sun’s rays. The sunlight is then absorbed and used for energy

vibrava.desc: Vibrava's wings have not yet completed the process of growing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more useful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.
vibrava.evolve: Vibrava can evolve into Flygon at level 16 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

victreebel.desc: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

vigoroth.desc: igoroth is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can't tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This Pokémon's stress level rises if it can't be moving constantly.
vigoroth.evolve: Vigoroth can evolve into Slaking at level 14 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

vileplume.desc: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.

volbeat.desc: Volbeat's tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

voltorb.desc: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
voltorb.evolve: Voltorb can evolve into Electrode at level 8 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

vulpix.desc: Both its fur and its tails are beautiful. As it grows, the tails split and form more tails.
vulpix.evolve: Vulpix can evolve into Ninetales at level 8 and above with the help of a Fire Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

wailmer.desc: Wailmer's nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful Pokémon loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.
wailmer.evolve: Wailmer can evolve into Wailord at level 10 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 5 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

wailord.desc: Wailord is the largest of all identified Pokémon up to now. This giant Pokémon swims languorously in the vast open sea, eating massive amounts of food at once with its enormous mouth.

walrein.desc: Walrein swims all over in frigid seawater while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Its thick layer of blubber makes enemy attacks bounce off harmlessly.

wartortle.desc: When tapped on its head, this Pokémon will pull it in, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
wartortle.evolve: Wartortle can evolve into Blastoise at level 14 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

weedle.desc: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
weedle.evolve: Weedle can evolve into Kakuna at level 4 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 5 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

weepinbell.desc: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
weepinbell.evolve: Weepinbell can evolve into Victreebel at level 14 and above with the help of a Leaf Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

weezing.desc: This Pokémon lives and grows by absorbing poison gas, dust, and germs that exist inside garbage.

whiscash.desc: If Whiscash goes on a wild rampage, it sets off a quake-like tremor with a radius of over three miles. This Pokémon has the ability to predict real earthquakes.

whismur.desc: Normally, Whismur's voice is very quiet-it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this Pokémon senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.
whismur.evolve: Whismur can evolve into Loudred at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

wigglytuff.desc: Its body is very elastic. By inhaling deeply, it can continue to inflate itself without limit.

wingull.desc: Wingull has the habit of carrying prey and valuables in its beak and hiding them in all sorts of locations. This Pokémon rides the winds and flies as if it were skating across the sky.
wingull.evolve: Wingull can evolve into Pelipper at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

wobbuffet.desc: Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks-it won't attack on its own. However, it won't endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the Pokémon will try to take the foe with it using Destiny Bond.

wooper.desc: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.
wooper.evolve: Wooper can evolve into Quagsire at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

wurmple.desc: Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pokémon's feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.
wurmple.evolve:
Wurmple can evolve into Silcoon when it
 reaches level 4 and above during the day, or Cascoon when it reaches level 4 and above at night. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 6 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

wynaut.desc: Wynaut can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face. Look at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this Pokémon will be slapping the ground with its tail.
wynaut.evolve: Wynaut can evolve into Wobbuffet at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

xatu.desc: It’s said that while this Pokémon has the power to predict the future, it’s not powerful enough to change the future it sees.

yanma.desc: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.

zangoose.desc: Memories of battling its archrival Seviper are etched into every cell of Zangoose's body. This Pokémon adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.

zapdos.desc: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.

zigzagoon.desc: Zigzagoon restlessly wanders everywhere at all times. This Pokémon does so because it is very curious. It becomes interested in anything that it happens to see.
zigzagoon.evolve: Zigzagoon can evolve into Linoone at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

zubat.desc: Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as a sonar used to check for objects in its way.
zubat.evolve: Zubat can evolve into Golbat at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

abilities.Adaptability: This Pokémon's STAB is increased by +1 at all levels.
abilities.Aftermath: This Pokémon deals damage to an attacker equal to half of the damage received when knocked out by a melee move.
abilities.Air Lock: While this Pokémon enters battle, weather-related abilities have no effect on the Pokémon that have them.
abilities.Anger Point: After suffering a critical hit, this Pokémon adds proficiency to its damage if its next attack hits.
abilities.Aqua Camoflauge: Once per short rest, this Pokémon gains temporary hit points equal to its level when battling in coastal and swampy areas, or in rainy conditions.
abilities.Arena Trap: Wild Pokémon cannot flee from this Pokémon if it is active in battle, except if they are flying-type, or use the Levitate ability,.
abilities.Battle Armor: This Pokémon is immune to extra damage dealt by a Critical Hit.
abilities.Big Pecks: This Pokémon's AC cannot be reduced by an opponent's moves.
abilities.Blaze: When this Pokémon falls below 10% of its maximum HP, double the STAB damage for its fire-type moves.
abilities.Burrower: This Pokémon can burrow underground traveling a distance equal to its walking speed before re-emerging.
abilities.Cacophony: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.
abilities.Chlorophyll: This Pokémon’s speed is doubled in bright sunlight.
abilities.Clear Body: Other Pokémon's moves or abilities cannot lower this Pokémon stats.
abilities.Cloud Nine: While this Pokémon is in battle, weather-related abilities have no effect on the Pokémon that have them.
abilities.Color Change: When hit by a damaging attack, this Pokémon's type changes to the type that hit it. It takes on the new type's resistances, vulnerabilities, and immunities.
abilities.Competitive: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage rolls while poisoned, burned, confused, or paralyzed.
abilities.Compound Eyes: This Pokémon gets an additional +1 to attack rolls.
abilities.Cursed Body: When hit by a melee attack, this Pokémon may roll 1d4. On a result of 4, the opponent who made the attack cannot use the same move on its next turn.
abilities.Cute Charm: Once per short rest, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy attack roll of your choice.
abilities.Damp: This Pokémon is unaffected by Self Destruct and Explosion moves.
abilities.Defiant: When this Pokémon is subject to a move that gives it a status condition, it has advantage on the next attack.
abilities.Download: Once per short rest, this Pokémon can choose a different damage type for one of their normal attacks.
abilities.Drizzle: A constant light rain forms on the battlefield when the Pokémon enters into combat. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.
abilities.Drought: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to bright sunlight. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.
abilities.Early Bird: This  Pokémon has advantage on rolls to wake from sleep.
abilities.Effect Spore: When hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of grass damage equal to your proficiency modifier to your attacker.
abilities.Flame Body: The flames from this Pokémon's body shine dim light in a 15 ft radius. In addition, when hit by a melee attack, roll a d10. On a 10, the attacker is burned.
abilities.Flash Fire: This Pokémon takes no damage from fire. Instead, immediately after taking a hit from a fire-type move, or in open flames, double the STAB bonus on the next fire-type move.
abilities.Forecast: This Pokémon changes form with the weather. In rain it becomes water-type, in bright sun it becomes fire-type, in cold and snowy conditions it becomes ice-type. In all other conditions it is normal-type. Its STAB, resistance, immunities, and vulnerabilities change to match the form it takes.v
abilities.Friend Guard: Once per long rest, when an ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is hit by an attack, it may choose to halve the damage dealt.
abilities.Frisk: Upon entering a battle, a single opponent’s held item is revealed, if it has one.
abilities.Gluttony: This Pokémon must eat its held berry when it falls below ½ of its maximum HP.
abilities.Guts: When this Pokémon is burned or poisoned, they are not affected by the disadvantage or half damage effects. They still take damage at the end of each of their turns.
abilities.Harvest: At the end of this Pokémon's turn, if it used a berry, roll 1d4. On a result of 3 or 4, it regains that berry as a held item.
abilities.Healer: As an action, this Pokémon can touch an ally to restore a negative status effect.
abilities.Healing Rain: This Pokémon can use its action to heal hit points equal to its level, in rainy conditions.
abilities.Huge Power: Once per short rest, this Pokémon may double the damage it does on a single move that requires an attack roll. The player must announce that they are using this ability before the attack roll.
abilities.Hustle: When this Pokémon scores a critical hit, it may immediately use the same move to attack again at disadvantage.
abilities.Hydration: This Pokémon is unaffected by negative status ailments in water or during rainy conditions.
abilities.Hyper Cutter: This Pokémon’s ability modifiers cannot be decreased by an opponent’s moves.
abilities.Ice Body: While it is snowing or hailing, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency modifier at the end of each of its turns.
abilities.Illuminate: This Pokémon knows the "Light" cantrip and can cast it at will.
abilities.Immunity: This Pokémon is immune to becoming poisoned.
abilities.Imposter: This Pokémon can use Transform as a bonus action.
abilities.Infiltrator: This Pokémon bypasses Light Screen and Reflect.
abilities.Inner Focus: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.
abilities.Insomnia: This Pokémon is immune to sleep.
abilities.Intimidate: Once per short rest, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy attack roll of your choice.
abilities.Justified: When this Pokémon is hit by a dark-type move, it gets advantage on its next attack.
abilities.Keen Eye: This Pokémon ignores disadvantage when it relates to sight.
abilities.Leaf Guard: This Pokémon does not suffer from any negative status ailments in bright sunlight.
abilities.Levitate: This Pokémon is immune to ground moves.
abilities.Lightning Rod: If an ally within 30 feet is attacked with an electric type move, this Pokémon can choose to use a reaction to redirect that attack to themselves instead. This does not work on area of effect moves.
abilities.Limber: This Pokémon is immune to being paralyzed.
abilities.Liquid Ooze: If an enemy uses a leeching or absorb move against this Pokémon, the Pokémon must make a DC 12 CON save or become poisoned.
abilities.Magic Guard: If this Pokémon is subjected to a move that forces it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage on a success.
abilities.Magma Armor: This Pokémon is immune to freezing.
abilities.Magnet Pull: Steel opponents in battle with this Pokémon may not switch out or flee.
abilities.Marvel Scale: This Pokémon's AC increase by 2 when suffering from a negative status condition.
abilities.Minus: This Pokémon boosts its attack and damage rolls by 2 if an ally also has a Plus or Minus ability
abilities.Moody: At the end of each long rest, this Pokémon rerolls on the nature table, replacing its nature with the result until the next long rest.
abilities.Moxie: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon may immediately take another action.
abilities.Multiscale: If this Pokémon is at full health, the first attack that hits it deals half damage.
abilities.Natural Cure: This Pokémon is cured of negative status ailments upon returning to its Pokeball.
abilities.Normalize: Every move this Pokémon makes is Normal type.
abilities.Oblivious: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.
abilities.Overcoat: This Pokémon does not take damage from weather-related moves like Hail, Weather Ball, etc.
abilities.Overgrow: When this Pokémon falls below 10% of its maximum HP, double the STAB damage for its grass-type moves.
abilities.Own Tempo: This Pokémon is immune to becoming confused.
abilities.Paper Thin: This Pokémon always has a maximum HP of 1.
abilities.Pick Up: If an opponent uses a consumable held item in battle, this Pokémon gains a copy of it if it is not currently holding an item.
abilities.Pickpocket: As a bonus action, this Pokémon can make a DEX check contested by the opponent’s WIS to attempt to steal a held item. After the first attempt, all other attempts against the same opponent are rolled at disadvantage.
abilities.Plus: This Pokémon boosts its attack and damage rolls by 2 if an ally also has a Plus or Minus ability
abilities.Poison Heal: If this Pokémon is poisoned, the amount of damage dealt by the poison heals the Pokémon instead.
abilities.Poison Point: On melee attacks made by this Pokémon, roll a d10 on a hit. On a result of a 10, the target is poisoned.
abilities.Poison Touch: When this Pokémon is hit with a melee attack, roll a 1d4. On a result of 4, the attacker takes an amount of poison damage equal to this Pokémon’s proficiency modifier.
abilities.Prankster: Once per short rest, this Pokémon can move to the top of initiative order in a single round, but must use a status-affecting move on its turn.
abilities.Pressure: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly costs an additional 1 PP.
abilities.Protean: This Pokémon's type changes to the type of move it uses, just before the move is used. It takes on the new type's resistances, vulnerabilities, and immunities.
abilities.Pure Power: Once per short rest, this Pokémon may double the damage it does on a single move that requires an attack roll. The player must announce that they are using this ability before the attack roll.
abilities.Quick Feet: When suffering from a negative status condition, this Pokémon’s speed increases by 15 ft.
abilities.Rain Dish: In rainy conditions, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency bonus at the end of each of its turns.
abilities.Rattled: When this Pokémon is hit by a damaging Dark, Bug, or Ghost move, it makes its next attack at advantage.
abilities.Regenerator: Once per long rest, this Pokémon regains hit points equal to its level when it returns to its Pokéball.
abilities.Rivalry: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage when attacking a Pokémon of the same type.
abilities.Rock Head: This Pokémon takes no recoil damage.
abilities.Rough Skin: When hit by a melee attack roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of normal damage eaual to your proficiency modifier to your attacker.
abilities.Run Away: While this Pokémon is active, the trainer automatically succeeds on their DEX roll to run away from a wild Pokémon encounter.
abilities.Sand Force: During a Sandstorm, this Pokémon can double its STAB when it hits an opponent.
abilities.Sand Rush: This Pokémon’s speed is doubled in desert terrain, or during a Sandstorm.
abilities.Sand Stream: A constant Sandstorm covers the battlefield when this Pokémon enters a battle. This Pokémon may use the move Sandstorm as a bonus action. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.
abilities.Sand Veil: This Pokémon’s AC increases by 2 in desert terrain, or during a Sandstorm.
abilities.Sap Sipper: This Pokémon is immune to grass-type moves. If hit by a grass type move, it takes no damage and instead absorbs the energy, granting advantage on its next attack.
abilities.Scrappy: This Pokémon's Normal and Fighting type moves hit Ghost type Pokémon.
abilities.Serene Grace: The DC to avoid a negative status condition from this Pokémon is increased by 1.
abilities.Shadow Tag: If this Pokémon is active, an opponent cannot flee or be switched out.
abilities.Shed Skin: If this Pokémon is affected by a negative status ailment, they can roll a d4 at the end of each of their turns. On a result of 4, they are cured.
abilities.Sheer Force: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage rolls while poisoned, burned, confused, or paralyzed.
abilities.Shell Armor: This Pokémon is immune to extra damage dealt by a Critical Hit.
abilities.Shield Dust: Once per long rest, this Pokémon can ignore a negative status condition that results from an enemy move.
abilities.Simple: Once per short rest, you may double this Pokémon's Move modifier for a single attack or damage roll.
abilities.Skill Link: On combo moves like Fury Swipes, Comet Punch, etc., this Pokémon is guaranteed to hit at least twice.
abilities.Sniper: On a critical hit made by this Pokémon, triple the dice roll instead of doubling it.
abilities.Snow Cloak: This Pokémon's AC is increased by 2 in arctic conditions, or when it is snowing or hailing.
abilities.Solar Power: Damage rolls for this Pokémon get an additional +2 during bright sunlight.
abilities.Solid Rock: This Pokémon does not take any additional damage from a critical hit.
abilities.Soundproof: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.
abilities.Speed Boost: While this Pokémon is active and in an environment related to its type (DM Discretion), its trainer gets advantage on initiative rolls.
abilities.Static: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a result of 4, the attacker takes an amount of electric damage equal to this Pokemon's proficiency bonus.
abilities.Steadfast: Once per long rest, when this Pokémon fails a saving throw against a negative status condition, it can choose to pass instead.
abilities.Stench: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, roll a d10. On a 10, the attacker flinches.
abilities.Sticky Hold: Held items cannot be stolen or knocked away from this Pokémon.
abilities.Stone Veil: This Pokémon's AC is increased by 2 in rocky terrain, or during a Sandstorm.
abilities.Storm Drain: If an ally within 30 feet is attacked with a water type move, this Pokémon can use a reaction to choose to redirect that attack to themselves instead, gaining an amount of HP equal to half the damage dealt. This does not work on area of effect moves.
abilities.Sturdy: When this Pokémon takes an amount of damage from a single hit that is equal or greater than half the Pokémon's maximum HP, the damage is halved.
abilities.Suction Cups: This Pokémon cannot be forced out of battle by an opponent’s moves.
abilities.Super Luck: This Pokémon increases its critical hit range by 1 (20 to 19+, etc.)
abilities.Swarm: This Pokémon adds doubles its STAB bonus when it has 10% or less of its maximum health.
abilities.Swift Swim: This Pokémon's swim speed is doubled in rainy conditions.
abilities.Synchronize: If this Pokémon becomes burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, its attacker receives the negative status condition as well (if not immune).
abilities.Tangled Feet: Attacks against this Pokémon have disadvantage when it is confused.
abilities.Technician: For damaging moves activated by this Pokémon with 15 PP or more, they may roll the damage twice and use the higher result.
abilities.Telepathy: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.
abilities.Thick Fat: This Pokémon takes quarter damage from Fire and Ice type moves.
abilities.Torrent: When this Pokémon falls below 10% of its health, double the STAB damage for its water-type moves.
abilities.Toxic Boost: When this Pokémon is hit by a poison-type attack, its next attack is rolled at advantage.
abilities.Trace: This Pokémon copies a random ability of an opponent when entering battle. The ability cannot be Flower Gift, Forecast, Illusion, Imposter, Multitype, Trace, Wonder Guard, or Zen Mode.
abilities.Transformer:
This Pokémon has a standard Normal form from which all stats are based, but may change forms as a bonus action to drastically change its abilities. The forms it can take are Attack, Defense, and Speed. 
- In Attack form, it adds an additional +5 to its attack rolls, but all attacks against it has advantage.
- In Defense form, its AC increases by 3, but its attacks are rolled at disadvantage. If the activated move requires a save, the target(s) have advantage.
- In Speed form, it gains an additional attack action each turn, but the attack is done at disadvantage. If it is a move that requires a save, the target(s) have advantage.
abilities.Truant: This Pokémon cannot use the same move in back to back rounds.
abilities.Unburden: While this Pokémon is active and not holding an item, its trainer gets advantage on initiative rolls.
abilities.Unnerve: Opponents in combat with this Pokémon cannot eat held berries.
abilities.Vital Spirit: This Pokémon cannot be put to sleep.
abilities.Volt Absorb: Electric type moves do not damage this Pokémon. Instead, half of any electric damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.
abilities.Water Absorb: Water type moves do not damage this Pokémon. Instead, half of any water damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.
abilities.Water Veil: This Pokémon is immune to burning.
abilities.Water Weight: Once per short rest, this Pokémon gains temporary hit points equal to its level when battling in coastal and swampy areas, or in rainy conditions.
abilities.White Smoke: Other Pokémon's moves or abilities cannot lower this Pokémon stats.
abilities.Wonder Guard: This Pokémon is immune to damaging attacks from types that are not in its vulnerabilities list.
abilities.Wonder Skin: This Pokémon has advantage on all saving throws related to being burned, frozen, poisoned, or paralyzed.
